messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

LGTM
is this triggered by some catastrophe?

https://codereview.appspot.com/9392049/diff/5001/include/README
File include/README (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/9392049/diff/5001/include/README#newcode2
include/README:2: toolchain, so please don't install these files to system include file
s/install/copy/
s/these files/them/
s/system/the system/

https://codereview.appspot.com/9392049/diff/5001/include/README#newcode3
include/README:3: directory (e.g. /usr/include or /usr/local/include).
(/usr/include, /usr/local/include, etc.)

LGTM
is this triggered by some catastrophe?

On Wednesday, May 22, 2013, r wrote:
>
> is this triggered by some catastrophe?
>
i've seen at least two cases where packager installs those files
to system include dir and causing problems.

one case is macports, see http://code.google.com/p/go/issues/detail?id=2407
for the motivation issue.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=45468e9eae1f ***

include: add a README file

R=golang-dev, r
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/9392049

subject: code review 9392049: include: add a README file
